flashcards.english: Mũirĩtu arĩ naũ? (Who is with the girl?) → Ndĩ nake (I am with her). Rũhiũ rũrĩ naũ? (Who has the big knife?) → Ndĩ na ruo (I have it)
flashcards.notes: Introduction to object concords. 'Na ũ?' = 'with who/what?'. Object concords change based on noun class: -ke (Class 1 sing), -ruo (Class 6 sing)

flashcards.kikuyu: Complete Object Concord System by Noun Class
flashcards.english: Class 1: nake (sg) / nao (pl), Class 2: naguo (sg) / nayo (pl), Class 3: nayo (sg) / nacio (pl), Class 4: nakĩo (sg) / nacio (pl), Class 5: narĩo (sg) / namo (pl), Class 6: naruo (sg) / nacio (pl)
flashcards.notes: Pattern: [Noun] [Subject Prefix] na ũ? → Ndĩ na [Object Concord]. Subject prefixes: e/me (Cl1), wĩ/ĩrĩ (Cl2), ĩrĩ/ciĩ (Cl3), kĩ/ciĩ (Cl4), rĩ/me (Cl5), rwĩ/ciĩ (Cl6). Key: object concord matches noun class of object

examples.kikuyu: Mũĩrĩtu e na ũ? → Ndĩ nake
examples.english: Who is with the girl? → I am with her

examples.kikuyu: Rũhĩũ rwĩ na ũ? → Ndĩ naruo
examples.english: Who has the knife? → I have it

flashcards.english: Class 1: Mwana ũyũ wakwa nĩ mwega (This my child is good) - ũyũ = this one. Class 4: Gĩtĩ gĩkĩ gĩakwa nĩ kĩega (This my chair is good) - gĩkĩ = this one
flashcards.notes: Demonstratives must agree with noun class. Class 1: ũyũ (this), Class 4: gĩkĩ (this). Possessives also agree: wakwa (my-Cl1), gĩakwa (my-Cl4). Subject prefixes: nĩ mwega (Cl1), nĩ kĩega (Cl4)
